Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Feature Request] Private feeds locked by an ApiKey" (#8455) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Current NuGet gallery is for public consumption - it's like a single, PUBLIC feed. 

Would love to have a the ability to create private feeds, locked by api keys (which already exist).

Currently we could:
- Use one of the -other- nuget server implementations that exist but this means we need to manage them (which most people don't need to want to manage anything, these days)
- Use a commercial product. This is good for businesses that making a profit/want extra security+complience/advanced features/etc ... but there's still a section of the community that don't need all of that and/or don't make money (but still would like private feeds).

So it would be really awesome if this could be a feature that could be considered.


(This idea was raised in #8314 )

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Recover my old account" (#8452) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello,
I've a problem recovering my old account, it has been year I didn't published any package now I want to reuse my old nuget account because I'm "back in business"

The pr0oblem is that if I login with the old account using user and password it says I can't
So I used my microsoft account to register but I want to reuse my old account, how can I do that?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "PMUI doesn't make clear when no actions were performed by a Package Management Action" (#10664) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Please read the following information before posting the issue. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet client tools (the Visual Studio extension, NuGet.exe command line tool, etc.), you are in the right place. -->
<!-- If you're having trouble with the NuGet.org Website, please post in [NuGetGallery issues](http://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues) -->

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): VS

Product version: 

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: unsure

If PMUI resolves 0 actions here: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/Actions/UIActionEngine.cs#L358, I believe it will either complete silently (when `uiService.DisplayPreviewWindow` is false), or will throw the following exception due to an `Assumes` clause in the project manager service.


https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio/Services/NuGetProjectManagerService.cs#L583
  ```
at Microsoft.Assumes.Fail(String message)
   at Microsoft.Assumes.NotNullOrEmpty[T](ICollection`1 values)
   at NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio.NuGetProjectManagerService.<GetProjectsWithDeprecatedDotnetFrameworkAsync>d__22.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask`1.get_Result()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ConfiguredValueTaskAwaitable`1.ConfiguredValueTaskAwaiter.GetResult()
   at Microsoft.ServiceHub.Framework.ServiceJsonRpcDescriptor.LocalProxyGeneration.<ReturnedValueTaskOfTHelper>d__25`1.MoveNext()
```


## Repro steps and/or sample project

<!-- Please add as much details as possible to help us to reproduce your problem. -->
To be investigated whether or not this can be hit by a customer outside of a bug scenario, but basically invoke this without any resolvable actions: [PerformActionImplAsync](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.UI/Actions/UIActionEngine.cs#L284)

From PMUI directly, an Install/Update/Uninstall action would trigger this, but the state must be such that no actions are resolved. If this is found to be impossible, close this bug.

Depending on the resolution, we may want to propagate errors better [in the service method above](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio/Services/NuGetProjectManagerService.cs#L583) by using `CatchAndRethrowExceptionAsync` as other places now use.

### Verbose Logs

<!-- Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...) -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "textfile.nuspec failing to build the project after upgrading to Visual Studio 2019 16.9.1 from Version 16.8.7" (#10663) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_This issue has been moved from [a ticket on Developer Community](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/textfilenuspec-failing-to-build-the-pro/1368425)._ --- [regression] [worked-in:16.8.0] I have a .NET standard project which is having textfile.nuspec. When i was building the project it is failing with error. After updagrading to latest Visual studio 2019 16.9.1. It was working without any issues on 16.8.X Task Parameter:RestoreOutputPath=C:\temp\Formatters\MyProject\obj\ 1> C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.201\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(221,5): error : Object reference not set to an instance of an object. 1> System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object. 1> at NuGet.Packaging.PackageBuilder.<>c.b__173_1(NuGetFramework groupFramework) 1> at System.Linq.Enumerable.WhereSelectEnumerableIterator`2.MoveNext() 1> at System.Collections.Generic.HashSet`1.UnionWith(IEnumerable`1 other) 1> at System.Collections.Generic.HashSet`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection, IEqualityComparer`1 comparer) 1> at NuGet.Packaging.PackageBuilder.ValidateReferenceAssemblies(IEnumerable`1 files, IEnumerable`1 packageAssemblyReferences) 1> at NuGet.Packaging.PackageBuilder.Save(Stream stream) 1> at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.BuildPackage(PackageBuilder builder, String outputPath, Boolean symbolsPackage) 1> at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.BuildFromNuspec(String path) 1> at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.BuildPackage(String path) 1> at NuGet.Commands.PackCommandRunner.RunPackageBuild() 1> at NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.PackTaskLogic.BuildPackage(PackCommandRunner runner) 1> at NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.PackTask.Execute() 1> Done executing task "PackTask" -- FAILED. 1>Done building target "GenerateNuspec" in project "MyProject.csproj" -- FAILED. 1> Thanks and Regards,. Som --- ### Original Comments #### Feedback Bot on 3/14/2021, 07:24 PM:

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

--- ### Original Solutions (no solutions)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Signing:  add tests verifying primary + timestamp + countersignature + timestamp with expired primary/repository signing certificates" (#10651) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "Feature Request: Flag to fail restore if package.config contains prerelease" (#10662) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

I've read through the docs for the CLI and this doesn't seem to exist. 

Our usecase:
We run .NET builds through CI with separate configurations for different environments (Dev, Debug, UAT, Production)
We'd like to fail builds on Debug, UAT and Production that contain prerelease packages, but allow them on Dev. This would let us be confident that we only push up Nuget references that were intended for release, rather than Nuget packages created during development.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Update the background and foreground color tokens of the PMUI to CommonDocumentColors" (#10608) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
The background color token used in the PMUI is from the BrandedUI category and should be updated to use the background token from the CommonDocumentColors category to match the foreground text. This change should be done behind an experiment to validate the results. This issue is related to https://github.com/NuGet/Client.Engineering/issues/714 and the fix applied for that issue should be reintroduced.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe): Visual Studio

Product version: 

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: N/A

## Repro steps and/or sample project

N/A

### Verbose Logs

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Feature Suggestion: Provide a switch or config to ignore the package downloading from trustless sources" (#9734) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Situation

I have two package sources:

1. [nuget.org](https://nuget.org): This is the only fully trusted source.
1. A private NuGet source: this is a mirror source of the former one, and it also provides some private packages.

What matters is that the second source lists a package not existed and download it from the first one. But the downloading operation fails at very high risk so that it provides an error to the NuGet client:

> C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.1.201\NuGet.targets(124,5): error : Source "second [http://**.**.**.**/nuget" lists the package "dotnetcampus.picktextvaluetask.1.1.322", but all downloads to this package fails.

## Suggestion

I have a suggestion to the NuGet client to ignore errors to the trustless source. Maybe one of these solutions works:

My first alternate suggestion: Add an attribute to the NuGet.config file as below:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" />
    <add key="rubbish.xx" value="http://xx.xx.xx.xx/v3/index.json" treatAsTrustless="true" />
  </packageSources>
</configuration>
```

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<configuration>
  <packageSources>
    <add key="nuget.org" value="https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json" protocolVersion="3" isTrustSource="true" />
    <add key="rubbish.xx" value="http://xx.xx.xx.xx/v3/index.json" />
  </packageSources>
</configuration>
```

If I configure the NuGet like this and run `nuget restore`, the nuget client only fetch packages from those trustless sources if all the trust sources don't have.

My second alternate suggestion: Add a command-line option to fulfill the same effect as the first one.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "nuget restore results in a package integrity check failure on big endian system" (#10567) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used: NuGet.exe 

Product version: Built from master

Worked before: N/A

## Repro steps and/or sample project

A run of `dotnet build` on a big endian system borks with `The package integrity check failed.` when `msbuild` tries to restore packages

The `VerifySignedPackageIntegrity` method is not endian-aware which results in a verification failure. The attached patch works for both little and big endian systems and may provide insight into creating a _real_ solution to the problem.

[diff-nuget.txt](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/5969176/diff-nuget.txt)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "PM UI:  cannot bulk update packages" (#10510) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/10510 regressed PM UI update scenarios.  The root problem is [this](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/commit/c995174aaea8d55e1504e9afba83696922497712#diff-80991ce1edef4f242608751b70dd2d48dad8e24a28dbefd2b68a3a7784a12f21R1556) change.  Previously, updating selected packages in the Updates tab of PM UI passes the package identities for the _desired_ packages.  This commit passes the package identities for the _currently installed_ packages.  As a result, PM UI now reports that are no actions to perform.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | Visual Studio | MSBuild.exe | dotnet.exe):  Visual Studio PM UI

### Product version: 
Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2019 Int Preview
Version 16.10.0 Preview 1.0 [30929.219.main]
NuGet:  latest dev (@ commit 4991066d8d78053b389b07819afba78b88e66340)

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:   dev 5.9.0.7083

## Repro steps

1.  Create a new C# ASP.NET Web Application (.NET Framework) with these options:

    *  Framework:  .NET Framework 4.8
    *  Type:  Web Forms

2.  In Solution Explorer right-click on the project node and select "Manage NuGet Packages..."
3.  In NuGet Package Manager UI navigate to the Updates tab.
4.  Check (enable) the "Select all packages" checkbox.
5.  Click the Update button.

### Expected result
Error List:  "Unable to resolve dependencies. 'bootstrap 5.0.0-beta1' is not compatible with 'AspNet.ScriptManager.bootstrap 4.5.3 constraint: bootstrap (>= 4.5.2 && < 4.5.4)'.	"		

### Actual result
*  Error List:  "An internal error occurred. Please contact Microsoft Support."	
*  Output window's "Package Manager" pane:

```
Attempting to gather dependency information for multiple packages with respect to project 'WebApplication1', targeting '.NETFramework,Version=v4.8'
Gathering dependency information took 827 ms
Attempting to resolve dependencies for multiple packages.
Resolving dependency information took 0 ms
Resolving actions install multiple packages
Resolution was successful but resulted in no action
There are no new updates available.
No package updates are available from the current package source for project 'WebApplication1'.
StreamJsonRpc.RemoteInvocationException: An internal error occurred. Please contact Microsoft Support.
   at Microsoft.ServiceHub.Framework.ServiceJsonRpcDescriptor.LocalProxyGeneration.<ReturnedValueTaskOfTHelper>d__25`1.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask`1.get_Result()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ValueTaskAwaiter`1.GetResult()
   at NuGet.PackageManagement.UI.UIActionEngine.<ShouldContinueDueToDotnetDeprecationAsync>d__16.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ValueTaskAwaiter`1.GetResult()
   at NuGet.PackageManagement.UI.UIActionEngine.<>c__DisplayClass11_0.<<PerformActionImplAsync>b__0>d.MoveNext()
RPC server exception:
Microsoft.Assumes+InternalErrorException: An internal error occurred. Please contact Microsoft Support.
      at Microsoft.Assumes.Fail(String message)
      at Microsoft.Assumes.True(Boolean condition, String message)
      at Microsoft.Assumes.NotNullOrEmpty[T](ICollection`1 values)
      at NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio.NuGetProjectManagerService.<GetProjectsWithDeprecatedDotnetFrameworkAsync>d__22.MoveNext()
   --- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
      at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
      at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
      at System.Threading.Tasks.ValueTask`1.get_Result()
      at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.ConfiguredValueTaskAwaitable`1.ConfiguredValueTaskAwaiter.GetResult()
      at Microsoft.ServiceHub.Framework.ServiceJsonRpcDescriptor.LocalProxyGeneration.<ReturnedValueTaskOfTHelper>d__25`1.MoveNext()

Time Elapsed: 00:00:01.0345980
========== Finished ==========
```

### Verbose Logs

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Custom V2 OData queries will be deprecated March 9th, 2021 " (#54) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We announced the deprecation of custom V2 OData queries (#37) last year and conducted a dry run of the deprecation to ensure that there are no surprises for users (#40). 

We will begin blocking endpoints used by 3rd party clients in March 9, 2021, as detailed in [the blogpost here](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/custom-v2-odata-queries-will-be-deprecated-march-9-2021/).

Please let us know about your questions or concerns on [this discussion post.](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/7423)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021" (#53) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
The current NuGet.org repository signing certificate will be updated as soon as March 15th, 2021. If you validate that packages are repository signed by NuGet.org using a [NuGet client policy](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/consume-packages/installing-signed-packages), the [`NuGet.exe verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/nuget/reference/cli-reference/cli-ref-verify) command, or the [`dotnet nuget verify`](https://docs.microsoft.com/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-verify) command, you will need to take steps by March 15th, 2021 to avoid disruptions when installing packages from NuGet.org signed with the new certificate. 

If you are unsure if you will be impacted or want to see instructions to allow the new certificate, please see our blogpost on the matter: https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/the-nuget-org-repository-signing-certificate-will-be-updated-as-soon-as-march-15th-2021/
